comments:
I20040422

- start with new workspace
- File > New > Project
- create a java project
- when asked whether to swith to Java perspective, say Yes
-> Java perspective opened, Intro view at right border, contents same as
full-screen (not the "What is ..." thing with the "Return to Introduction" link)

build 20040517.
With the steps above, I get a blank Intro in standby mode.

workbench UI code does not seem to be refreshing the intro control. 

Kim, is this part of the defect to enabling/disabling redraw on standby? 

(ping Kim)

Interesting... I can reproduce the lack of redraw portion of this bug when
running on I200405171219, but not the stack trace.  That might be a red herring.
 Additionally, I can't reproduce this at all with the code from HEAD in a
runtime workspace.  I'm not sure what we could've changed in the past day to
make this work...  perhaps we had some redraw pervention on perspective
switching that has since been removed.  I'll ask around and will confirm this
behaviour in todays build candidate.

OK, this is still happening in the latest build, but (I THINK) has since been
fixed in HEAD (presumably by Stefan Xenos - he was working after our 8pm build
submission last night).

The reason I said I THINK above is because the intro behaviour seems to have
changed.  I'm not sure if it's a symptom of this bug or if its intentional
behaviour.  

Have you guys changed the behaviour of the "Go To Workbench" icon in the
fullscreen intro to close the intro instead of setting standby true?  I've got a
breakpoint on SWTExceptions and whenever I hit that button IntroUrl is
(eventually) throwing it.  It's hard to tell if that exception is killing the
view or if this is the intended behaviour and the exception is unrelated.  When
that action is finished, I have no standby-mode intro part.

Additionally, if I doubleclick on the tab area of the maximized intro view the
standby version is empty except for a 'return to introduction' link.  In this
state the home, forward and backward toolbar buttons are enabled but none of
them do anything.

Is this what you expect to happen now?

Yes Kim.. we did chsnge the behavior of the GO To Workbench. This now closes 
the Intro instead of putting it in Standby mode as it used to do.

As for empty intro, we where told by Kevin H. to remove the ContextStandby 
part (trhe one with the F1). This is why the standby part is empty. For now, 
this is the intended behavior. I put in HEAD code that makes it look a bit 
better.
re: the SWTExpetion, this is another bug that I was chancing last night and I 
couldnt figure it out. But it is irrelevant of this bug. When I opened this 
bug I tried it with a simple Intro (not our cutomizableIntroPart).
Ok, cool.  I'm going to mark this as fixed then and will verify with the next build.
Closing to keep a tidy house.  Pardon the spam.
